notes: PySpark accepts column name in the form of string or list of column names.
teradatamlspk only accepts list of column names.
user_action: Make sure to replace the string 'Specify list of column names' placeholder with the list of column names.

register.Name: register()
notes: pandas_udf() is not yet supported in teradatamlspk.
user_action: Make sure to convert the functionality to use udf instead of pandas_udf.

cast.Name: cast()
notes: teradatamlspk does not support casting data to BooleanType, BinaryType, ArrayType, StructType and MapType.

astype.Name: astype()
notes: teradatamlspk does not support casting data to BooleanType, BinaryType, ArrayType, StructType and MapType.

cast.Name: cast()
notes: In pyspark, cast do not accept any argument while converting column to TimestampNTZType.
In teradatamlspk, cast() accepts an argument format while converting column to TimestampNTZType. This argument specifies the format of column value(s). Look at format specifiers for Teradata.
user_action: Make sure to pass the additional argument format while casting to TimestampNTZType. Refer to the example.

astype.Name: astype()
notes: In pyspark, astype do not accept any argument while converting column to TimestampNTZType.
In teradatamlspk, astype() accepts an argument format while converting column to TimestampNTZType. This argument specifies the format of column value(s). Look at format specifiers for Teradata.
user_action: Make sure to pass the additional argument format while casting to TimestampNTZType. Refer to the example.
